align: justify">The Report fully complies with the requirements of Section 13(a)
or 15(d) of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934; and</P>
</TD></TR>
<TR><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=top width=48><P style="margin:0px; 
padding:0px">&nbsp;</P></TD><TD style="margin-top:0px" valign=top width=672><P 
style="margin:0px; padding:0px">&nbsp;</P></TD></TR>

Company.</P>

  <fttn:GoingConcernNoteTextBlock id="Tag141" contextRef="C1">&lt;div 
id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div 
style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Note 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;. 
Going Concern&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The accompanying financial 
statements have been prepared assuming that the Company will continue as a going
concern. For the six&amp;#160;months ended March 31, 2015, the Company had a net
loss of $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;529,920&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;and negative cash flow from operating activities of 
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;116,998&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;. As of March 31, 2015, the Company had negative working capital of 
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;517,872&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
10pt;"&gt;.&amp;#160;Management does not anticipate having positive cash flow 
from operations in the near future.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;These factors raise a 
substantial doubt about the Company's ability to continue as a going concern. 
The accompanying consolidated financial statements do not include any 
adjustments to reflect the possible future effects on the recoverability and 
classification of assets or the amounts and classifications of liabilities that 
may result from the possible inability of the Company to continue as a going 
concern.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The Company does not have the 
resources at this time to repay its credit and debt obligations, make any 
payments in the form of dividends to its shareholders or fully implement its 
business plan. Without additional capital, the Company will not be able to 
remain in business.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Management has plans to address
the Company's financial situation as follows:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;In the near term, management 
plans to continue to focus on raising the funds necessary to implement the 
Company's business plan. Management will continue to seek out debt financing to 
obtain the capital required to meet the Company's financial obligations. There 
is &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; 
assurance, however, that lenders will continue to advance capital to the Company
or that the new business operations will be profitable. The possibility of 
failure in obtaining additional funding and the potential inability to achieve 
profitability raise doubts about the Company's ability to continue as a going 
concern.&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;In the long term, management believes that the 
Company's projects and initiatives will be successful and will provide cash flow
to the Company, which will be used to finance the Company's future growth. 
However, there can be no assurances that the Company's planned activities will 
be successful, or that the Company will ultimately attain profitability. The 
Company's long-term viability depends on its ability to obtain adequate sources 
of debt or equity funding to meet current commitments and fund the continuation 
of its business operations, and the ability of the Company to achieve adequate 
profitability and cash flows from operations to sustain its 
operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</fttn:GoingConcernNoteTextBlock>

gaap:InvestmentsInDebtAndMarketableEquitySecuritiesAndCertainTradingAssetsDisclo
sureTextBlock id="Tag147" contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' 
style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;
&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Note 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;4&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;. Investments in Available for Sale 
Securities&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;On October 11, 2013, we entered
into an agreement with Biofuels Power Corp. (&amp;#147;Biofuels Power&amp;#148;)
to acquire the common stock of Biofuels Power. Under the terms of the agreement,
we will contribute introductions and consulting with respect to marketing and 
introductions for business. In addition, we will fund up to 
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;100,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;
in monthly contributions of $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
10pt;"&gt;20,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;.
These contributions are solely at the discretion of the Company. In exchange for
the contributions, we will receive common stock of Biofuels Power Corp. at 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;two&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;-thirds of the market price of the common 
stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;During the year ended 
September&amp;#160;30, 2014, we contributed $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;35,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; to the joint venture through the purchase of 
Biofuel Power's common stock. As a result, we acquired 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;194,067&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;
shares of Biofuel Power common stock. The shares were valued at 
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;55,309&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;on March 31, 2015 based on the closing market price of the 
stock on that date. The shares of common stock owned by the Company represent 
less than five percent of the outstanding shares of Biofuel 
Power.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;

  <us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock id="Tag164" 
contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times 
New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Note 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;. 
Related Party Transactions&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
10pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;On March 14, 2014, the Company 
entered into a participation and operating agreement (the 
&amp;#147;Participation Agreement&amp;#148;) with SoHo Resource Holdings I, LLC 
(&amp;#147;SoHo&amp;#148;) for the joint acquisition and development of oil and 
gas leases in Bell, Milam, Falls, Robertson, Limestone, Freestone, Leon, Madison
and Brazos counties in Texas (the &amp;#147;Target Area&amp;#148;). Under the 
terms of the Participation Agreement, the Company will pay 
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;300&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; per
acre for its proportionate share of acreage in the Target Area (the 
&amp;#147;Target Acreage&amp;#148;). The Target Acreage, which will not have 
more than a &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;25&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% 
royalty burden, will be acquired by SoHo, who will manage all operations under 
the Participation Agreement. Under the terms of the Participation Agreement, the
Company will be invoiced for its share of the Target Acreage cost and will have 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;thirty&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; 
days to pay its proportionate cost for the Target Acreage. The Company will pay 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;33.33&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% 
of the drilling and completion costs associated with the wells drilled and/or 
recompleted on the Target Acreage in order to receive its 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
10pt;"&gt;25.00&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% 
working interest in the wells until payout and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;18.75&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 10pt;"&gt;% working interest after well payout. Under the terms of the 
Participation Agreement, the Company must remit its proportionate share of 
drilling and completion costs within &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;fifteen&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; days of notice by SoHo.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;G. Jonathan Pi&amp;#241;a, our 
former CEO, owns&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;50&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% of 
the membership interest in SoHo; however, he does not have daily management 
oversight of SoHo. As of March 31, 2015, the Company had made 
$&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;100,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;
in payments to SoHo.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:RelatedPartyTransactionsDisclosureTextBlock>
  <fttn:AdvancesFromThirdPartiesDisclosureTextBlock id="Tag165" 
contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times 
New Roman';"&gt;
  &lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Note 
6&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;. 
Advances&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;During the six 
months ended March 31, 2015, Vista View Ventures, Inc. advanced 
$&lt;font&gt;119,810&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#160;to the Company for working capital. 
These advances are non-interest bearing and payable on demand. During the same 
period, the Company refinanced $&lt;font&gt;167,810&lt;/font&gt; of the advances
into convertible notes payable with Vista View Ventures, Inc. As of March 31, 
2015 and September 30, 2014, advances in the amount of 
$&lt;font&gt;0&lt;/font&gt; and $&lt;font&gt;48,000&lt;/font&gt;, respectively, 
are included in current liabilities on the consolidated balance 
sheets.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;During the six months ended March 31, 2015, we recognized 
$&lt;font&gt;2,465&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#160;of imputed interest expense on these 
advances.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</fttn:AdvancesFromThirdPartiesDisclosureTextBlock>

&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;br/&gt;Imputed Interest&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;During six months ended March 31, 2015, the Company recognized imputed
interest of $2,465 as an increase to shareholders' 
equity.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityNoteDisclosureTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:SubsequentEventsTextBlock id="Tag174" contextRef="C1">&lt;div 
id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;
  &lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
    &lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 9. Subsequent Events&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; 
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;On &lt;font&gt;April 1, 2015&lt;/font&gt;, the Company issued a 
convertible note payable to Eaton Central America, Inc. 
(&amp;#147;Eaton&amp;#148;) in the amount of $&lt;font&gt;140,275&lt;/font&gt; 
in exchange for Eaton paying off accounts payable in the same amount. On April 
1, 2015, Eaton owned &lt;font&gt;4,711,250&lt;/font&gt; shares of common stock 
of the Company which represented approximately &lt;font&gt;14&lt;/font&gt;% of 
our outstanding stock. The note bears interest at &lt;font&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;% 
per year and is convertible into common stock of the Company at the rate of 
$&lt;font&gt;0.02&lt;/font&gt; per share. All principal and accrued interest is 
payable on &lt;font&gt;April 1, 2017&lt;/font&gt;.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;p 
style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;On &lt;font&gt;May 12, 2015&lt;/font&gt;, the holders of our 
convertible notes elected to convert principal and interest in the amount of 
$&lt;font&gt;64,000&lt;/font&gt; into &lt;font&gt;1,600,000&lt;/font&gt; shares 
of common stock.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt; &lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-

gaap:OrganizationConsolidationAndPresentationOfFinancialStatementsDisclosureText
Block id="Tag189" contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-
family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 
'times new roman', times;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Note 1. General Organization and 
Business&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt; font-family: 'times new roman', times;"&gt;First Titan Corp., a Florida 
corporation, was incorporated on September 16, 2010. The Company's year-end is 
September 30. The Company formed to design and manufacture both panel and 
engineered/tooled custom vacuum formed instrument panels and wiring harnesses, 
required for the monitoring of any final product that utilizes a gas or diesel 
engine source. The Company is currently primarily an oil and gas exploration 
company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt; font-family: 'times new roman', times;"&gt;On September 16, 2011, First 
Titan Corporation created First Titan Energy, LLC to invest in oil and gas 
properties, greenfield projects and in the development of 
innovative&amp;#160;exploration and production 
technologies.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt; font-family: 'times new roman', times;"&gt;On September 16, 2011, we 
formed a new subsidiary company, First Titan Technical, LLC, to commence 
business operations designing and marketing automotive electronics custom-
designed for heavy-duty vehicles.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-

double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="11.4"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; $ 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="115.2"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" align="right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;46,521&lt;/font&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="23.467"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="11.4"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; $ 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="115.2"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" align="right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;8,711&lt;/font&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="11.2"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;All principal along with accrued interest is payable on the maturity 
date. The notes are convertible into common stock at the option of the holder. 
The holder of the notes cannot convert the notes into shares of common stock if 
that conversion would result in the holder owning more than 
&lt;font&gt;4.9&lt;/font&gt;% of the outstanding stock of the 
Company.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Advances Refinanced into Convertible Promissory 
Notes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;During the three months ended March 31, 2015, the Company has signed 
Convertible Promissory Notes that refinance non-interest bearing advances into 
convertible notes payable. The Convertible Promissory Notes bear interest at 
&lt;font&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;% per annum and are payable along with accrued 
interest. The Convertible Promissory Note and unpaid accrued interest are 
convertible into common stock at the option of the 
holder.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="top" 
width="22.8"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="11.4"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; $ 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="top" width="77"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" align="right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;167,810&lt;/font&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="top" 
width="22.867"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="11.4"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; $ 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="74.933"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" align="right"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;151,203&lt;/font&gt; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The Company evaluated the terms of this note in accordance with ASC 
Topic &lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;font&gt;815&lt;/font&gt; &amp;#150; 
&lt;font&gt;40&lt;/font&gt;, &lt;i&gt;Derivatives and Hedging - Contracts in 
Entity's Own Stock&lt;/i&gt; and determined that the underlying common stock is 
indexed to the Company's common stock. The Company determined that the 
conversion feature did not meet the definition of a liability and therefore did 
not bifurcate the conversion feature and account for it as a separate derivative
liability. The Company evaluated the conversion feature for a beneficial 
conversion feature. The effective conversion price was compared to the market 
price on the date of the notes and was deemed to be less than the market value 
of underlying common stock at the inception of the notes. Therefore, the Company
recognized a beneficial conversion feature of $&lt;font&gt;102,013&lt;/font&gt; 
and $&lt;font&gt;49,190&lt;/font&gt; on December 31, 2014 and March 31, 2015, 
respectively. The beneficial conversion feature was recognized as an increase in
additional paid-in capital and a discount to the Convertible Notes Payable. The 
discount to the Convertible Notes Payable is being amortized to interest expense
over the life of the notes using the effective interest 
method.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The Company evaluated the application of ASC 
&lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;50&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;40&lt;/font&gt;/&lt;font&gt;55&lt;/font&gt;, &lt;i&gt;Debtor's 
Accounting for a Modification or Exchange of Debt Instrument&lt;/i&gt; as it 
applies to the note listed above and concluded that the revised terms 
constituted a debt modification rather than a debt extinguishment because the 
present value of the cash flow under the terms of each of the new instruments 
was less than &lt;font&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;% from the present value of the 
remaining cash flows under the terms of the original notes. 
&lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt; gain or loss on the modifications was required to be
recognized.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Conversions to Common Stock&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;During six months ended March 31, 2015, the holders of the Convertible
Note Payable dated September 30, 2013 elected to convert principal and accrued 
interest in the amounts show below into share of common stock at a rate of 
$&lt;font&gt;0.04&lt;/font&gt; per share. On the conversion date, the 
unamortized discount related to the principal amount converted was immediately 
amortized to interest expense. No gain or loss was recognized on the conversions
as they occurred within the terms of the agreement that provided for 
conversion.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;

  <us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock id="Tag345" 
contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times 
New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Cash and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;For the purpose of the 
financial statements, cash equivalents include all highly liquid investments 
with maturity of &lt;font&gt;three&lt;/font&gt; months or less. Cash and cash 
equivalents were $&lt;font&gt;3,131&lt;/font&gt; and 
$&lt;font&gt;1,211&lt;/font&gt; at March 31, 2015 and September 30, 2014, 
respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:CashAndCashEquivalentsPolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:OilAndGasPropertiesPolicyPolicyTextBlock id="Tag346" 
contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times 
New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Oil and Gas 
Properties&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The Company follows the full 
cost method of accounting for its oil and gas properties, whereby all costs
incurred in connection with the acquisition, exploration for and development of 
petroleum and natural gas reserves are capitalized. Such costs include lease 
acquisition, geological and geophysical activities, rentals on non-producing 
leases, drilling, completing and equipping of oil and gas wells and 
administrative costs directly attributable to those activities and asset 
retirement costs. Disposition of oil and gas properties are accounted for as a 
reduction of capitalized costs, with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;font&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; gain or loss recognized unless such adjustment would significantly 
alter the relationship between capital costs and proved reserves of oil, in 
which case the gain or loss is recognized in the statement of 
operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Depletion of capitalized oil 
and gas properties and estimated future development costs, excluding unproved 
properties, are based on the units-of-production method based on proved 
reserves. The company recognized $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 10pt;"&gt;11,718&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160; and $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;30,630&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;of depletion during the six&amp;#160;months ended March 31, 
2015 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;, 
respectively. Net capitalized costs of oil and gas properties, less related 
deferred taxes, are limited to the lower of unamortized cost or the cost 
ceiling, defined as the sum of the present value of estimated future net 
revenues from proved reserves based on unescalated prices discounted at 
&lt;font&gt;&lt;font&gt;ten&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; percent, plus the cost of properties not being 
amortized, if any, plus the lower of cost or estimated fair value of unproved 
properties included in the costs being amortized, if any, less related income 
taxes. As of March 31, 2015, the Company has oil and gas properties in the 
amount of $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;300,575&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;, which are being excluded from amortization because they have not 
been evaluated to determine whether proved reserves are associated with those 
properties. Costs in excess of the present value of estimated future net 
revenues as discussed above are charged to impairment expense. The Company 
applies the full cost ceiling test on a quarterly basis on the date of the 
latest balance sheet presented.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Based on management's review, 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;100&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% of
the unproved oil and gas properties balance as of March 31, 2015 are expected to
be added to amortization during the year ending September 30, 2015. 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The table below sets forth the
cost of unproved properties excluded from the amortization base as of March 31, 
2015 and notes the year in which the associated costs were 
incurred:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;
&lt;div class="CursorPointer"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;Asset retirement 
costs are recognized when the asset is placed in service, and are included in 
the amortization base and amortized over proved reserves using the units of 
production method. Asset retirement costs are estimated by management using 
existing regulatory requirements and anticipated future inflation 
rates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:OilAndGasPropertiesPolicyPolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:StockholdersEquityPolicyTextBlock id="Tag347" contextRef="C1">&lt;div
id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div 
style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Common 
Stock&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The Company records common 
stock issuances when all of the legal requirements for the issuance of such 
common stock have been satisfied.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:StockholdersEquityPolicyTextBlock>

  <us-gaap:CapitalizedCostsOfUnprovedPropertiesExcludedFromAmortization

  <us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock id="Tag353" contextRef="C1">&lt;div 
id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div 
style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Earnings (Loss) 
per Common Share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The Company computes basic and diluted earnings per common share 
amounts in accordance with ASC Topic 260, &lt;i&gt;Earnings per Share&lt;/i&gt;.
The basic earnings (loss) per common share are calculated by dividing the 
Company's net income available to common shareholders by the weighted average 
number of common shares outstanding during the year. The diluted earnings (loss)
per common share are calculated by dividing the Company's net income (loss) 
available to common shareholders by the diluted weighted average number of 
shares outstanding during the year. The diluted weighted average number of 
shares outstanding is the basic weighted number of shares adjusted as of the
first of the year for any potentially dilutive debt or equity. There are 
&lt;font&gt;no&lt;/font&gt; dilutive shares outstanding for any periods 
reported.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In periods in which a net loss has been incurred, all potentially 
dilutive common shares are considered anti-dilutive and thus are excluded from 
the calculation. The Company's convertible debt is considered anti-dilutive due 
to the Company's net loss for the &lt;font&gt;six&lt;/font&gt; months and three 
months ended March 31, 2015 and 2014. As a result, the Company did not have any 
potentially dilutive common shares for those periods. For the 
&lt;font&gt;six&lt;/font&gt; months and three months ended March 31, 2015 and 
2014, potentially issuable shares as a result of conversions of convertible 
notes payable have been excluded from the calculation of diluted earnings per 
share.&amp;#160;At March 31, 2015, the Company had 
&lt;font&gt;36,680,971&lt;/font&gt; &amp;#160;potentially issuable shares upon 
the conversion of convertible notes payable and interest.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:EarningsPerSharePolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:FairValueAssetsMeasuredOnRecurringAndNonrecurringBasisTableTextBlock

double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="15.533"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;$&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="60.4"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;font&gt;&amp;#151;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt
;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="15.533"&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="51.533"&gt;

double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="59.2"&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="54.8"&gt;

gaap:FairValueAssetsMeasuredOnRecurringAndNonrecurringBasisTableTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:CapitalizedCostsOfUnprovedPropertiesExcludedFromAmortization 
id="Tag355" contextRef="C538535" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">100000</us-
gaap:CapitalizedCostsOfUnprovedPropertiesExcludedFromAmortization>
  <us-gaap:CapitalizedCostsOfUnprovedPropertiesExcludedFromAmortization 
id="Tag356" contextRef="C1" unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
  <us-
gaap:CapitalizedCostsOfUnprovedPropertiesExcludedFromAmortizationCumulative 
id="Tag357" contextRef="C11" unitRef="USD" decimals="0">300575</us-
gaap:CapitalizedCostsOfUnprovedPropertiesExcludedFromAmortizationCumulative>
  <us-gaap:OtherAssetsFairValueDisclosure id="Tag358" contextRef="C23" 
unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
  <us-gaap:OtherAssetsFairValueDisclosure id="Tag359" contextRef="C24" 
unitRef="USD" xsi:nil="true" />
  <us-gaap:OtherAssetsFairValueDisclosure id="Tag360" contextRef="C25" 
unitRef="USD" decimals="0">20702</us-gaap:OtherAssetsFairValueDisclosure>
  <us-gaap:FairValueOfFinancialInstrumentsPolicy id="Tag361" 
contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times 
New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Financial 
Instruments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The Company's balance sheet 
includes certain financial instruments. The carrying amounts of current assets 
and current liabilities approximate their fair value because of the relatively 
short period between the origination of these instruments and their expected 
realization.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;FASB Accounting Standards 
Codification (ASC) 820 &lt;i&gt;Fair Value Measurements and 
Disclosures&lt;/i&gt; (ASC 820) defines fair value as the exchange price that 
would be received for an asset or paid to transfer a liability (an exit price)
in the principal or most advantageous market for the asset or liability in an 
orderly transaction between market participants on the measurement date. ASC 820
also establishes a fair value hierarchy that distinguishes between (1) market 
participant assumptions developed based on market data obtained from independent
sources (observable inputs) and (2) an entity's own assumptions about market 
participant assumptions developed based on the best information available in the
circumstances (unobservable inputs). The fair value hierarchy consists of three 
broad levels, which gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices in 
active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1) and the lowest 
priority to unobservable inputs (Level 3). The three levels of the fair value 
hierarchy are described below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class="CursorPointer"&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 
0px;"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="96" style="border-left: none; border-right: none; border-top: 
none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; text-align: 
left;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" style="border-left: none; border-right: none; border-top: 
none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; text-align: 
left;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 0px 32px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times 
new roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Level 1 - 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Unadjusted quoted prices in 
active markets that are accessible at the measurement date for identical, 
unrestricted assets or liabilities. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; 
text-align: left;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; 
text-align: left;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 0px 32px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times 
new roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Level 2 - 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Inputs other than quoted 
prices included within Level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability, 
either directly or indirectly, including quoted prices for similar assets or 
liabilities in active markets; quoted prices for identical or similar assets or 
liabilities in markets that are not active; inputs other than quoted prices that
are observable for the asset or liability (e.g., interest rates); and inputs 
that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable market data by 
correlation or other means. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; 
text-align: left;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; 
text-align: left;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 0px 32px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times 
new roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Level 3 - 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Inputs that are both 
significant to the fair value measurement and unobservable. 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Fair value estimates discussed 
herein are based upon certain market assumptions and pertinent information 
available to management as of March 31, 2015. The respective carrying value of 
certain on-balance-sheet financial instruments approximated their fair values 
due to the short-term nature of these instruments. These financial instruments 
include accounts receivable, other current assets, accounts payable, and accrued
expenses. The fair value of the Company's notes payable is estimated based on 
current rates that would be available for debt of similar terms that is not 
significantly different from its stated 
value.&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The following table presents assets that were measured and recognized 
at fair value as of March 31, 2015 and September 30, 2014 and the periods then 
ended on a recurring and nonrecurring basis:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;

&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;$&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;

align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;300,575&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;" valign="top"

&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;

  <us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock id="Tag368" 
contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times 
New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;;display: block;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Note 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;font&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;. Summary of Significant Accounting 
Policies&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Interim Financial
Statements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The accompanying unaudited 
financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles
generally accepted in the United States of America (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;) 
for interim financial information and with the instructions to Form 10-Q and 
Regulation S-X. Accordingly, the consolidated financial statements do not 
include all of the information and footnotes required by GAAP for complete 
financial statements. In the opinion of management, all adjustments considered 
necessary for a fair presentation have been included and such adjustments are of
a normal recurring nature. These consolidated financial statements should be 
read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements for the fiscal 
year ended September 30, 2014 and notes thereto and other pertinent information 
contained in our Form 10-K the Company has filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission (the &amp;#147;SEC&amp;#148;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The results of operations for 
the &lt;font&gt;six&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#160;month period ended March 31, 2015 are 
not necessarily indicative of the results to be expected for the full fiscal 
year ending September 30, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Consolidated 
Financial Statements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The consolidated financial 
statements of the Company include the accounts of the Company and its wholly 
owned subsidiaries, First Titan Energy, LLC and First Titan Technical, LLC, from
the date of their formations. Significant intercompany transactions have been 
eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Use of 
Estimates&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;The preparation of financial 
statements in conformity with accounting principles generally accepted in the 
United States of America requires management to make estimates and assumptions 
that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosure of 
contingent assets and liabilities at the date of the financial statements and 
the reported amounts of revenue and expenses during the reporting period. Actual
results could differ from those estimates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Credit Risk due 
to Certain Concentrations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;We extend credit, primarily in 
the form of uncollateralized oil and gas sales through the operators of our 
working interests, to various companies in the oil and gas industry, which 
results in a concentration of credit risk. The concentration of credit risk may 
be affected by changes in economic or other conditions within our industry and 
may accordingly affect our overall credit risk. However, we believe that the 
risk of these unsecured receivables is mitigated by the nature of the companies 
to which we extend credit. For the six&amp;#160;months ended March 31, 2015, 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;font&gt;two&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; operators accounted for 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
10pt;"&gt;83&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% and
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;17&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% of 
our oil and gas sales. Those operators account for 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;74&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% and
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;26&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% of 
accounts receivable as of March 31, 2015. We did not recognize any credit losses
during the three months ended March 31, 2015. We have not recognized an 
allowance for doubtful accounts as of March 31, 2015. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Cash and Cash 
Equivalents&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;For the purpose of the 
financial statements, cash equivalents include all highly liquid investments 
with maturity of &lt;font&gt;three&lt;/font&gt; months or less. Cash and cash 
equivalents were $&lt;font&gt;3,131&lt;/font&gt; and 
$&lt;font&gt;1,211&lt;/font&gt; at March 31, 2015 and September 30, 2014, 
respectively.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Oil and Gas 
Properties&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The Company follows the full 
cost method of accounting for its oil and gas properties, whereby all costs 
incurred in connection with the acquisition, exploration for and development of 
petroleum and natural gas reserves are capitalized. Such costs include lease 
acquisition, geological and geophysical activities, rentals on non-producing 
leases, drilling, completing and equipping of oil and gas wells and 
administrative costs directly attributable to those activities and asset 
retirement costs. Disposition of oil and gas properties are accounted for as a 
reduction of capitalized costs, with &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;font&gt;no&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; gain or loss recognized unless such adjustment would significantly 
alter the relationship between capital costs and proved reserves of oil, in 
which case the gain or loss is recognized in the statement of 
operations.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Depletion of capitalized oil 
and gas properties and estimated future development costs, excluding unproved 
properties, are based on the units-of-production method based on proved 
reserves. The company recognized $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-
size: 10pt;"&gt;11,718&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160; and $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;30,630&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;of depletion during the six&amp;#160;months ended March 31, 
2015 and &lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;,
respectively. Net capitalized costs of oil and gas properties, less related 
deferred taxes, are limited to the lower of unamortized cost or the cost 
ceiling, defined as the sum of the present value of estimated future net 
revenues from proved reserves based on unescalated prices discounted at 
&lt;font&gt;&lt;font&gt;ten&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; percent, plus the cost of properties not being 
amortized, if any, plus the lower of cost or estimated fair value of unproved 
properties included in the costs being amortized, if any, less related income 
taxes. As of March 31, 2015, the Company has oil and gas properties in the 
amount of $&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;300,575&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;, which are being excluded from amortization because they have not 
been evaluated to determine whether proved reserves are associated with those 
properties. Costs in excess of the present value of estimated future net 
revenues as discussed above are charged to impairment expense. The Company 
applies the full cost ceiling test on a quarterly basis on the date of the 
latest balance sheet presented.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Based on management's review, 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;100&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% of
the unproved oil and gas properties balance as of March 31, 2015 are expected to
be added to amortization during the year ending September 30, 2015. 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The table below sets forth the
cost of unproved properties excluded from the amortization base as of March 31, 
2015 and notes the year in which the associated costs were 
incurred:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;
&lt;div class="CursorPointer"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;

&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;Development costs&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;" valign="top" 
width="19"&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;

width="19"&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="57.067"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;&amp;#151;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;

width="19"&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;

width="58.067"&gt;

align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;&amp;#151;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;

&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;$&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; border-top: 1.333px 
solid #000000; border-bottom: 3px double #000000;" valign="bottom"

width="57.067"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;100,000&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; border-top: 1.333px 
solid #000000; border-bottom: 3px double #000000;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;$&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; border-top: 1.333px 
solid #000000; border-bottom: 3px double #000000;" valign="bottom" 
width="57.067"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;&amp;#151;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; border-top: 1.333px 
solid #000000; border-bottom: 3px double #000000;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;$&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff; border-top: 1.333px 
solid #000000; border-bottom: 3px double #000000;" valign="bottom" 
width="62.067"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;300,575&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #ffffff;" valign="top" 
width="9.6"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;Asset retirement 
costs are recognized when the asset is placed in service, and are included in 
the amortization base and amortized over proved reserves using the units of 
production method. Asset retirement costs are estimated by management using 
existing regulatory requirements and anticipated future inflation 
rates.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Revenue Recognition&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;Sales of crude oil are recognized when the delivery to the purchaser 
has occurred and title has been transferred. This occurs when oil has been 
delivered to a pipeline or a tank lifting has occurred. Crude oil is priced on 
the delivery date based upon prevailing prices published by purchasers with 
certain adjustments related to oil quality and physical 
location.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Common 
Stock&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The Company records common 
stock issuances when all of the legal requirements for the issuance of such 
common stock have been satisfied.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Income Taxes&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The Company accounts for income taxes under ASC 740 &lt;i&gt;Income 
Taxes&lt;/i&gt;. Under the asset and liability method of ASC 740, deferred tax 
assets and liabilities are recognized for the future tax consequences 
attributable to differences between the financial statements carrying amounts of
existing assets and liabilities and their respective tax bases. Deferred tax 
assets and liabilities are measured using enacted tax rates expected to apply to
taxable income in the years in which those temporary differences are expected to
be recovered or settled. The effect on deferred tax assets and liabilities of a 
change in tax rates is recognized in income in the period the enactment occurs. 
A valuation allowance is provided for certain deferred tax assets if it is more 
likely than not that the Company will not realize tax assets through future 
operations. &lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt; deferred tax assets or liabilities were 
recognized as of March 31, 2015 or September 30, 2014.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Earnings (Loss) 
per Common Share&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The Company computes basic and diluted earnings per common share 
amounts in accordance with ASC Topic 260, &lt;i&gt;Earnings per Share&lt;/i&gt;.
The basic earnings (loss) per common share are calculated by dividing the 
Company's net income available to common shareholders by the weighted average 
number of common shares outstanding during the year. The diluted earnings (loss)
per common share are calculated by dividing the Company's net income (loss) 
available to common shareholders by the diluted weighted average number of 
shares outstanding during the year. The diluted weighted average number of 
shares outstanding is the basic weighted number of shares adjusted as of the 
first of the year for any potentially dilutive debt or equity. There are 
&lt;font&gt;no&lt;/font&gt; dilutive shares outstanding for any periods
reported.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In periods in which a net loss has been incurred, all potentially 
dilutive common shares are considered anti-dilutive and thus are excluded from 
the calculation. The Company's convertible debt is considered anti-dilutive due 
to the Company's net loss for the &lt;font&gt;six&lt;/font&gt; months and three 
months ended March 31, 2015 and 2014. As a result, the Company did not have any 
potentially dilutive common shares for those periods. For the 
&lt;font&gt;six&lt;/font&gt; months and three months ended March 31, 2015 and 
2014, potentially issuable shares as a result of conversions of convertible 
notes payable have been excluded from the calculation of diluted earnings per 
share.&amp;#160;At March 31, 2015, the Company had 
&lt;font&gt;36,680,971&lt;/font&gt; &amp;#160;potentially issuable shares upon 
the conversion of convertible notes payable and interest.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Financial 
Instruments&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The Company's balance sheet 
includes certain financial instruments. The carrying amounts of current assets 
and current liabilities approximate their fair value because of the relatively 
short period between the origination of these instruments and their expected 
realization.&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;FASB Accounting Standards 
Codification (ASC) 820 &lt;i&gt;Fair Value Measurements and 
Disclosures&lt;/i&gt; (ASC 820) defines fair value as the exchange price that 
would be received for an asset or paid to transfer a liability (an exit price) 
in the principal or most advantageous market for the asset or liability in an 
orderly transaction between market participants on the measurement date. ASC 820
also establishes a fair value hierarchy that distinguishes between (1) market 
participant assumptions developed based on market data obtained from independent
sources (observable inputs) and (2) an entity's own assumptions about market 
participant assumptions developed based on the best information available in the
circumstances (unobservable inputs). The fair value hierarchy consists of three 
broad levels, which gives the highest priority to unadjusted quoted prices in 
active markets for identical assets or liabilities (Level 1) and the lowest 
priority to unobservable inputs (Level 3). The three levels of the fair value 
hierarchy are described below:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class="CursorPointer"&gt;
&lt;table cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="font-size: 10pt; margin-top: 
0px;"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="96" style="border-left: none; border-right: none; border-top: 
none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; text-align: 
left;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" style="border-left: none; border-right: none; border-top: 
none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; text-align: 
left;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none;
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 0px 32px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times 
new roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Level 1 - 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Unadjusted quoted prices in 
active markets that are accessible at the measurement date for identical, 
unrestricted assets or liabilities. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; 
text-align: left;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; 
text-align: left;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 0px 32px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times 
new roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Level 2 - 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Inputs other than quoted 
prices included within Level 1 that are observable for the asset or liability, 
either directly or indirectly, including quoted prices for similar assets or 
liabilities in active markets; quoted prices for identical or similar assets or 
liabilities in markets that are not active; inputs other than quoted prices that
are observable for the asset or liability (e.g., interest rates); and inputs 
that are derived principally from or corroborated by observable market data by 
correlation or other means. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; 
text-align: left;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none; vertical-align: top; 
text-align: left;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td width="96" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px 0px 0px 32px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times 
new roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Level 3 - 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="624" valign="top" style="margin-top: 0px; border-left: none; 
border-right: none; border-top: none; border-bottom: none;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; Inputs that are both 
significant to the fair value measurement and unobservable. 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Fair value estimates discussed 
herein are based upon certain market assumptions and pertinent information 
available to management as of March 31, 2015. The respective carrying value of 
certain on-balance-sheet financial instruments approximated their fair values 
due to the short-term nature of these instruments. These financial instruments 
include accounts receivable, other current assets, accounts payable, and accrued
expenses. The fair value of the Company's notes payable is estimated based on 
current rates that would be available for debt of similar terms that is not 
significantly different from its stated 
value.&lt;br/&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The following table presents assets that were measured and recognized 
at fair value as of March 31, 2015 and September 30, 2014 and the periods then 
ended on a recurring and nonrecurring basis:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;

roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
