&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; border-bottom: 1px solid #000000;" 
valign="bottom" width="54.8"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;&amp;#151;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="top" 
width="161.333"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;Totals&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="top" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="15.533"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;$&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="59.2"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;52,379&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="15.533"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;$&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="60.4"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;font&gt;&amp;#151;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt
;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="15.533"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;$&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="51.533"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;b&gt;&lt;font&gt;20,273&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff;" valign="bottom" 
width="19"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="18.133"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;$&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px; background-color: #e1ffff; border-bottom: 3px 
double #000000;" valign="bottom" width="54.8"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" 
align="right"&gt;&lt;font&gt;&amp;#151;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Beneficial Conversion 
Feature&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;Beneficial conversion feature is a non-detachable conversion feature 
that is in the money at the commitment date. The Company follows the guidance of
ASC Subtopic &lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt; Debt with 
Conversion and Other Options to evaluate as to whether beneficial conversion 
feature exists. Pursuant to Section &lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;30&lt;/font&gt; an embedded beneficial 
conversion feature recognized separately under paragraph 
&lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;25&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;5&lt;/font&gt; shall be measured 
initially at its intrinsic value at the commitment date (see paragraphs 
&lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;30&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;9&lt;/font&gt; through 
&lt;font&gt;30&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;12&lt;/font&gt;) as the difference
between the conversion price (see paragraph &lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;30&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;) and the fair value of the common stock or other 
securities into which the security is convertible, multiplied by the number of 
shares into which the security is convertible. When the Company issues an debt 
or equity security that is convertible into common stock at a discount from the 
fair value of the common stock at the date the debt or equity security 
counterparty is legally committed to purchase such a security (Commitment Date),
a beneficial conversion charge is measured and recorded on the Commitment Date 
for the difference between the fair value of the Company's common stock and the 
effective conversion price of the debt or equity security. If the intrinsic 
value of the beneficial conversion feature is greater than the proceeds 
allocated to the debt or equity security, the amount of the discount assigned to
the beneficial conversion feature is limited to the amount of the proceeds 
allocated to the debt or equity security.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Commitments and 
Contingencies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The Company follows subtopic &lt;font&gt;450&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt; of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification to 
report accounting for contingencies. Certain conditions may exist as of the date
the consolidated financial statements are issued, which may result in a loss to 
the Company but which will only be resolved when &lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; or
more future events occur or fail to occur. The Company assesses such contingent 
liabilities, and such assessment inherently involves an exercise of judgment. 
There are &lt;font&gt;no&lt;/font&gt; known commitments or contingencies of 
March 31, 2015 and September 30, 2014.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recently Issued Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;We have reviewed the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update 
(&amp;#147;ASU&amp;#148;) accounting pronouncements and interpretations thereof 
that have effectiveness dates during the periods reported and in future periods.
The Company has carefully considered the new pronouncements that alter previous 
generally accepted accounting principles and does not believe that any new or 
modified principles will have a material impact on the corporation's reported 
financial position or operations in the near term. The applicability of any 
standard is subject to the formal review of our financial management and certain
standards are under consideration.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In May 2014, the FASB issued the FASB Accounting Standards Update 
&lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;09&lt;/font&gt; &amp;#147;&lt;i&gt;Revenue from Contracts with 
Customers (Topic &lt;font&gt;606&lt;/font&gt;)&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASU 
&lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;09&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#148;).&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;This guidance amends the existing FASB Accounting Standards 
Codification, creating a new Topic 
&lt;font&gt;606&lt;/font&gt;,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Revenue from Contracts with 
Customer.&lt;/i&gt;&amp;#160;The core principle of the guidance is that an 
entity should recognize revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or
services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the 
entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or 
services.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;To achieve that core principle, an entity should apply the following 
steps:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table style="margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt;" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="672"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Identify the contract(s) with the customer &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Identify the performance obligations in the contract 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Determine the transaction price &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;4&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the 
contract &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Recognize revenue when (or as) the entity satisfies performance 
obligations &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The ASU also provides guidance on disclosures that should be provided 
to enable financial statement users to understand the nature, amount, timing, 
and uncertainty of revenue recognition and cash flows arising from contracts 
with customers. Qualitative and quantitative information is required about the 
following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table style="margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt;" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="672"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Contracts with customers &amp;#150; including revenue and impairments
recognized, disaggregation of revenue, and information about contract balances 
and performance obligations (including the transaction price allocated to the 
remaining performance obligations) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Significant judgments and changes in judgments &amp;#150; determining
the timing of satisfaction of performance obligations (over time or at a point 
in time), and determining the transaction price and amounts allocated to 
performance obligations &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Assets recognized from the costs to obtain or fulfill a contract 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;ASU &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;09&lt;/font&gt; is 
effective for periods beginning after December 15, 2016, including interim 
reporting periods within that reporting period for all public entities. Early 
application is not permitted.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In June 2014, the FASB issued the FASB Accounting Standards Update 
&lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;12&lt;/font&gt; &amp;#147;&lt;i&gt;Compensation&amp;#151;Stock 
Compensation (Topic 
&lt;font&gt;718&lt;/font&gt;)&lt;/i&gt;:&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Accounting for Share-
Based Payments When the Terms of an Award Provide That a Performance Target
Could Be Achieved after the Requisite Service Period&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASU 
&lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;12&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#148;).&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" align="center"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The amendments clarify the proper method of accounting for share-based
payments when the terms of an award provide that a performance target could be 
achieved after the requisite service period. The Update requires that a 
performance target that affects vesting and that could be achieved after the 
requisite service period be treated as a performance condition. The performance 
target should not be reflected in estimating the grant-date fair value of the 
award. Compensation cost should be recognized in the period in which it becomes 
probable that the performance target will be achieved and should represent the 
compensation cost attributable to the period(s) for which the requisite service 
has already been rendered.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The amendments in this Update are effective for annual periods and 
interim periods within those annual periods beginning after December 15, 2015. 
Earlier adoption is permitted.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In August 2014, the FASB issued the FASB Accounting Standards Update 
&lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;15&lt;/font&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#147;Presentation of 
Financial Statements&amp;#151;Going Concern (Subtopic 
&lt;font&gt;205&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;40&lt;/font&gt;): Disclosure of 
Uncertainties about an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern 
(&amp;#147;ASU &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;15&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#148;).&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In connection with preparing financial statements for each annual and 
interim reporting period, an entity's management should evaluate whether there 
are conditions or events, considered in the aggregate, that raise substantial 
doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern within 
&lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; year after the date that 
the&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;financial statements are issued&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;(or 
within &lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; year after the date that 
the&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;financial statements are available to be 
issued&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;when applicable). Management's evaluation should be 
based on relevant conditions and events that are known and reasonably knowable 
at the date that the&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;financial statements are 
issued&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;(or at the date that the&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;financial 
statements are available to be issued&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;when applicable). 
Substantial doubt about an entity's ability to continue as a going concern 
exists when relevant conditions and events, considered in the aggregate, 
indicate that it is probable that the entity will be unable to meet its 
obligations as they become due within &lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; year after 
the date that the financial statements are issued (or available to be issued). 
The term&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;probable&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;is used consistently with
its use in Topic &lt;font&gt;450&lt;/font&gt;, 
Contingencies.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;When management identifies conditions or events that raise substantial
doubt about an entity's ability to continue as a going concern, management 
should consider whether its plans that are intended to mitigate those relevant 
conditions or events will alleviate the substantial doubt. The mitigating effect
of management's plans should be considered only to the extent that 
(&lt;font&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;) it is probable that the plans will be effectively 
implemented and, if so, (&lt;font&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;) it is probable that the 
plans will mitigate the conditions or events that raise substantial doubt about
the entity's ability to continue as a going concern.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;If conditions or events raise substantial doubt about an entity's 
ability to continue as a going concern, but the substantial doubt is alleviated 
as a result of consideration of management's plans, the entity should disclose 
information that enables users of the financial statements to understand all of 
the following (or refer to similar information disclosed elsewhere in the 
footnotes):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class="CursorPointer"&gt;
&lt;table style="margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt;" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="672"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; a. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Principal conditions or events that raised substantial doubt about 
the entity's ability to continue as a going concern (before consideration of 
management's plans) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; b. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Management's evaluation of the significance of those conditions or 
events in relation to the entity's ability to meet its obligations 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; c. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Management's plans that alleviated substantial doubt about the 
entity's ability to continue as a going concern. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;If conditions or events raise substantial doubt about an entity's 
ability to continue as a going concern, and substantial doubt is not alleviated 
after consideration of management's plans, an entity should include a statement 
in the footnotes indicating that there is &lt;i&gt;substantial doubt about the 
entity's ability to continue as a going concern&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;within 
&lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; year after the date that the financial statements 
are issued (or available to be issued). Additionally, the entity should disclose
information that enables users of the financial statements to understand all of 
the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class="CursorPointer"&gt;
&lt;table style="margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt;" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="672"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; a. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Principal conditions or events that raise substantial doubt about the
entity's ability to continue as a going concern &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; b. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Management's evaluation of the significance of those conditions or 
events in relation to the entity's ability to meet its obligations 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; c. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Management's plans that are intended to mitigate the conditions or 
events that raise substantial doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a 
going concern. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The amendments in this Update are effective for the annual period 
ending after December 15, 2016, and for annual periods and interim periods 
thereafter. Early application is permitted.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;Management does not believe that any recently issued, but not yet 
effective accounting pronouncements, if adopted, would have a material effect on
the accompanying consolidated financial statements.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Reclassification&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;Certain reclassifications have been made to the prior period financial
statements to conform to the current period presentation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Subsequent events&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The Company follows the guidance in Section 
&lt;font&gt;855&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;10&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;50&lt;/font&gt; of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification for 
the disclosure of subsequent events. The Company will evaluate subsequent events
through the date when the financial statements were issued. Pursuant to ASU 
&lt;font&gt;2010&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;09&lt;/font&gt; of the FASB Accounting
Standards Codification, the Company as an SEC filer considers its financial 
statements issued when they are widely distributed to users, such as through 
filing them on EDGAR.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:SignificantAccountingPoliciesTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:BasisOfAccounting id="Tag369" contextRef="C1">&lt;div 
id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div 
style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Interim Financial
Statements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The accompanying unaudited 
financial statements have been prepared in accordance with accounting principles
generally accepted in the United States of America (&amp;#147;GAAP&amp;#148;) 
for interim financial information and with the instructions to Form 10-Q and 
Regulation S-X. Accordingly, the consolidated financial statements do not 
include all of the information and footnotes required by GAAP for complete 
financial statements. In the opinion of management, all adjustments considered 
necessary for a fair presentation have been included and such adjustments are of
a normal recurring nature. These consolidated financial statements should be 
read in conjunction with the consolidated financial statements for the fiscal 
year ended September 30, 2014 and notes thereto and other pertinent information
contained in our Form 10-K the Company has filed with the Securities and 
Exchange Commission (the &amp;#147;SEC&amp;#148;).&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The results of operations for 
the &lt;font&gt;six&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#160;month period ended March 31, 2015 are 
not necessarily indicative of the results to be expected for the full fiscal 
year ending September 30, 2015.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:BasisOfAccounting>
  <us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock id="Tag370" contextRef="C1">&lt;div 
id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div 
style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Consolidated 
Financial Statements&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;The consolidated financial 
statements of the Company include the accounts of the Company and its wholly 
owned subsidiaries, First Titan Energy, LLC and First Titan Technical, LLC, from
the date of their formations. Significant intercompany transactions have been 
eliminated in consolidation.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:ConsolidationPolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskCreditRisk id="Tag371" contextRef="C1">&lt;div 
id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div 
style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;Credit Risk due 
to Certain Concentrations&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&amp;#160;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify; font-family: 'times new 
roman';"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;We extend credit, primarily in 
the form of uncollateralized oil and gas sales through the operators of our 
working interests, to various companies in the oil and gas industry, which 
results in a concentration of credit risk. The concentration of credit risk may 
be affected by changes in economic or other conditions within our industry and 
may accordingly affect our overall credit risk. However, we believe that the 
risk of these unsecured receivables is mitigated by the nature of the companies 
to which we extend credit. For the six&amp;#160;months ended March 31, 2015, 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;font&gt;two&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font 
style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt; operators accounted for 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;83&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% and
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;17&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% of 
our oil and gas sales. Those operators account for 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;74&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% and
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;26&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 10pt;"&gt;% of 
accounts receivable as of March 31, 2015. We did not recognize any credit losses
during the three months ended March 31, 2015. We have not recognized an 
allowance for doubtful accounts as of March 31, 2015. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:ConcentrationRiskCreditRisk>
  <us-gaap:DebtPolicyTextBlock id="Tag372" contextRef="C1">&lt;div 
id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div 
style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Beneficial Conversion
Feature&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;Beneficial conversion feature is a non-detachable conversion feature 
that is in the money at the commitment date. The Company follows the guidance of
ASC Subtopic &lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt; Debt with 
Conversion and Other Options to evaluate as to whether beneficial conversion 
feature exists. Pursuant to Section &lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;30&lt;/font&gt; an embedded beneficial 
conversion feature recognized separately under paragraph 
&lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;25&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;5&lt;/font&gt; shall be measured 
initially at its intrinsic value at the commitment date (see paragraphs 
&lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;30&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;9&lt;/font&gt; through 
&lt;font&gt;30&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;12&lt;/font&gt;) as the difference 
between the conversion price (see paragraph &lt;font&gt;470&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;30&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;) and the fair value of the common stock or other 
securities into which the security is convertible, multiplied by the number of 
shares into which the security is convertible. When the Company issues an debt 
or equity security that is convertible into common stock at a discount from the 
fair value of the common stock at the date the debt or equity security 
counterparty is legally committed to purchase such a security (Commitment Date),
a beneficial conversion charge is measured and recorded on the Commitment Date 
for the difference between the fair value of the Company's common stock and the 
effective conversion price of the debt or equity security. If the intrinsic 
value of the beneficial conversion feature is greater than the proceeds 
allocated to the debt or equity security, the amount of the discount assigned to
the beneficial conversion feature is limited to the amount of the proceeds 
allocated to the debt or equity security.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:DebtPolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesPolicyTextBlock id="Tag373" 
contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times 
New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Commitments and 
Contingencies&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The Company follows subtopic &lt;font&gt;450&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;20&lt;/font&gt; of the FASB Accounting Standards Codification to 
report accounting for contingencies. Certain conditions may exist as of the date
the consolidated financial statements are issued, which may result in a loss to 
the Company but which will only be resolved when &lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; or
more future events occur or fail to occur. The Company assesses such contingent 
liabilities, and such assessment inherently involves an exercise of judgment. 
There are &lt;font&gt;no&lt;/font&gt; known commitments or contingencies of 
March 31, 2015 and September 30, 2014.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;&lt;/div&gt;</us-gaap:CommitmentsAndContingenciesPolicyTextBlock>
  <us-gaap:ExplorationCosts id="Tag374" contextRef="C538535" unitRef="USD" 
xsi:nil="true" />
  <us-gaap:ExplorationCosts id="Tag375" contextRef="C1" unitRef="USD" 
xsi:nil="true" />
  <us-gaap:NewAccountingPronouncementsPolicyPolicyTextBlock id="Tag376" 
contextRef="C1">&lt;div id='EdgarSAA123457890000' style="font-family : 'Times 
New Roman';"&gt;&lt;div style="width: 720px; margin: 0px;"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;&lt;b&gt;Recently Issued Accounting 
Pronouncements&lt;/b&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;We have reviewed the FASB issued Accounting Standards Update 
(&amp;#147;ASU&amp;#148;) accounting pronouncements and interpretations thereof
that have effectiveness dates during the periods reported and in future periods.
The Company has carefully considered the new pronouncements that alter previous 
generally accepted accounting principles and does not believe that any new or 
modified principles will have a material impact on the corporation's reported 
financial position or operations in the near term. The applicability of any 
standard is subject to the formal review of our financial management and certain
standards are under consideration.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In May 2014, the FASB issued the FASB Accounting Standards Update 
&lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;09&lt;/font&gt; &amp;#147;&lt;i&gt;Revenue from Contracts with 
Customers (Topic &lt;font&gt;606&lt;/font&gt;)&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASU 
&lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;09&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#148;).&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;This guidance amends the existing FASB Accounting Standards 
Codification, creating a new Topic 
&lt;font&gt;606&lt;/font&gt;,&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Revenue from Contracts with 
Customer.&lt;/i&gt;&amp;#160;The core principle of the guidance is that an 
entity should recognize revenue to depict the transfer of promised goods or 
services to customers in an amount that reflects the consideration to which the 
entity expects to be entitled in exchange for those goods or 
services.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;To achieve that core principle, an entity should apply the following 
steps:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table style="margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt;" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="672"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Identify the contract(s) with the customer &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Identify the performance obligations in the contract 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Determine the transaction price &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;4&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Allocate the transaction price to the performance obligations in the 
contract &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;5&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Recognize revenue when (or as) the entity satisfies performance 
obligations &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The ASU also provides guidance on disclosures that should be provided 
to enable financial statement users to understand the nature, amount, timing, 
and uncertainty of revenue recognition and cash flows arising from contracts 
with customers. Qualitative and quantitative information is required about the 
following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;table style="margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt;" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="672"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Contracts with customers &amp;#150; including revenue and impairments
recognized, disaggregation of revenue, and information about contract balances 
and performance obligations (including the transaction price allocated to the 
remaining performance obligations) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Significant judgments and changes in judgments &amp;#150; determining
the timing of satisfaction of performance obligations (over time or at a point 
in time), and determining the transaction price and amounts allocated to 
performance obligations &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &lt;font&gt;3&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Assets recognized from the costs to obtain or fulfill a contract 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;ASU &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;09&lt;/font&gt; is 
effective for periods beginning after December 15, 2016, including interim 
reporting periods within that reporting period for all public entities. Early 
application is not permitted.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In June 2014, the FASB issued the FASB Accounting Standards Update 
&lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;12&lt;/font&gt; &amp;#147;&lt;i&gt;Compensation&amp;#151;Stock 
Compensation (Topic 
&lt;font&gt;718&lt;/font&gt;)&lt;/i&gt;:&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;Accounting for Share-
Based Payments When the Terms of an Award Provide That a Performance Target 
Could Be Achieved after the Requisite Service Period&amp;#148; (&amp;#147;ASU 
&lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;12&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#148;).&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px;" align="center"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The amendments clarify the proper method of accounting for share-based
payments when the terms of an award provide that a performance target could be 
achieved after the requisite service period. The Update requires that a 
performance target that affects vesting and that could be achieved after the 
requisite service period be treated as a performance condition. The performance 
target should not be reflected in estimating the grant-date fair value of the 
award. Compensation cost should be recognized in the period in which it becomes 
probable that the performance target will be achieved and should represent the 
compensation cost attributable to the period(s) for which the requisite service 
has already been rendered.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;The amendments in this Update are effective for annual periods and 
interim periods within those annual periods beginning after December 15, 2015. 
Earlier adoption is permitted.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In August 2014, the FASB issued the FASB Accounting Standards Update 
&lt;font&gt;No&lt;/font&gt;. &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;15&lt;/font&gt;&lt;i&gt;&amp;#160;&amp;#147;Presentation of 
Financial Statements&amp;#151;Going Concern (Subtopic 
&lt;font&gt;205&lt;/font&gt;-&lt;font&gt;40&lt;/font&gt;): Disclosure of 
Uncertainties about an Entity's Ability to Continue as a Going Concern 
(&amp;#147;ASU &lt;font&gt;2014&lt;/font&gt;-
&lt;font&gt;15&lt;/font&gt;&amp;#148;).&lt;/i&gt;&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;In connection with preparing financial statements for each annual and 
interim reporting period, an entity's management should evaluate whether there 
are conditions or events, considered in the aggregate, that raise substantial 
doubt about the entity's ability to continue as a going concern within 
&lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; year after the date that 
the&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;financial statements are issued&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;(or 
within &lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; year after the date that 
the&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;financial statements are available to be 
issued&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;when applicable). Management's evaluation should be
based on relevant conditions and events that are known and reasonably knowable 
at the date that the&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;financial statements are 
issued&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;(or at the date that the&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;financial 
statements are available to be issued&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;when applicable). 
Substantial doubt about an entity's ability to continue as a going concern 
exists when relevant conditions and events, considered in the aggregate, 
indicate that it is probable that the entity will be unable to meet its 
obligations as they become due within &lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; year after 
the date that the financial statements are issued (or available to be issued). 
The term&amp;#160;&lt;i&gt;probable&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;is used consistently with
its use in Topic &lt;font&gt;450&lt;/font&gt;, 
Contingencies.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;When management identifies conditions or events that raise substantial
doubt about an entity's ability to continue as a going concern, management 
should consider whether its plans that are intended to mitigate those relevant 
conditions or events will alleviate the substantial doubt. The mitigating effect
of management's plans should be considered only to the extent that 
(&lt;font&gt;1&lt;/font&gt;) it is probable that the plans will be effectively 
implemented and, if so, (&lt;font&gt;2&lt;/font&gt;) it is probable that the 
plans will mitigate the conditions or events that raise substantial doubt about 
the entity's ability to continue as a going concern.&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;If conditions or events raise substantial doubt about an entity's 
ability to continue as a going concern, but the substantial doubt is alleviated 
as a result of consideration of management's plans, the entity should disclose 
information that enables users of the financial statements to understand all of 
the following (or refer to similar information disclosed elsewhere in the 
footnotes):&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class="CursorPointer"&gt;
&lt;table style="margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt;" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="672"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; a. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Principal conditions or events that raised substantial doubt about 
the entity's ability to continue as a going concern (before consideration of 
management's plans) &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; b. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Management's evaluation of the significance of those conditions or 
events in relation to the entity's ability to meet its obligations 
&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; c. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Management's plans that alleviated substantial doubt about the 
entity's ability to continue as a going concern. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;/table&gt;
&lt;/div&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt;If conditions or events raise substantial doubt about an entity's 
ability to continue as a going concern, and substantial doubt is not alleviated 
after consideration of management's plans, an entity should include a statement 
in the footnotes indicating that there is &lt;i&gt;substantial doubt about the 
entity's ability to continue as a going concern&amp;#160;&lt;/i&gt;within 
&lt;font&gt;one&lt;/font&gt; year after the date that the financial statements 
are issued (or available to be issued). Additionally, the entity should disclose
information that enables users of the financial statements to understand all of 
the following:&lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;br/&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;div class="CursorPointer"&gt;
&lt;table style="margin-top: 0px; font-size: 10pt;" cellpadding="0" 
cellspacing="0"&gt;
&lt;tr style="font-size: 1pt;"&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="24"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td width="672"&gt;&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; a. &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; text-align: justify;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; Principal conditions or events that raise substantial doubt about the
entity's ability to continue as a going concern &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;/tr&gt;
&lt;tr&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size: 
10pt;"&gt; &amp;#160; &lt;/font&gt;&lt;/p&gt;
&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="24"&gt;

&lt;/td&gt;
&lt;td style="margin-top: 0px;" valign="top" width="672"&gt;
&lt;p style="margin: 0px; padding: 0px;"&gt;&lt;font style="font-size:
